com.i2group.apollo.service.loggingapi

Interface IUserActivityLogger

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    NoOpUserActivityLogger

    public interface IUserActivityLogger
    A logger that enables i2 Analyze services to record user activity.

    i2 Analyze uses an implementation of the logger to log all authenticated calls made by users. The default implementation does nothing, but can be replaced with a custom one.

    Note: Calls made by unauthenticated users are rejected by the web container, and do not result in calls to the logger.

    Note: Implementations of this interface must be thread-safe. User requests can arrive on multiple independent threads simultaneously, and the system is not guaranteed to create a new instance for every request.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isLoggingEnabled(String serviceName)
      Indicates whether logging is enabled for the specified i2 Analyze service.
      Object log(String serviceName, String methodName, Object... methodArguments)
      Logs information about a call to a specified method on a specified service, with the specified arguments.

    • Method Detail

      • isLoggingEnabled

        boolean isLoggingEnabled(String serviceName)
        Indicates whether logging is enabled for the specified i2 Analyze service.

        The platform calls this method before calling log(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.Object...), to allow skipping of log processing on a per-service basis.

        It is permitted (but inefficient) always to return true. Efficient implementations should only return true if their logging configuration is such that information provided to log(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.Object...) will actually get logged (and not simply ignored).

        Parameters:
        serviceName - A String containing the name of the service that has some activity to be logged (for example, "CommandService").
        Returns:
        true if the caller should continue by calling log(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.Object...); false otherwise.

      • log

        Object log(String serviceName,
           String methodName,
           Object... methodArguments)
        Logs information about a call to a specified method on a specified service, with the specified arguments.

        Note: The platform calls this method if and only if a preceding call to isLoggingEnabled(java.lang.String) returned true.

        Implementations of this method must not throw exceptions. This behavior could cause the user request to be abandoned, with the exception reported back to the user as a fault.

        Implementations of this method can choose their own logging strategy, and are under no obligation to use the information they receive. Implementations are also free to obtain additional logging information. For example, they might use a Provider to retrieve a Principal in order to obtain the details of the requesting user, or call System.currentTimeMillis() to determine the time on the server.

        Parameters:
        serviceName - A String containing the name of the service that has some activity to be logged (for example, "CommandService").
        methodName - A String containing the name of the service method that was called.
        methodArguments - Objects containing the arguments that were passed to the method. The implementation must not modify arguments, and must be aware of any security restrictions on argument content.
        Returns:
        An Object that must be null. The current version of i2 Analyze does not use this return value.
